meanings.definition: A Roman military officer commanding a century.
meanings.sent1: The centurion led his soldiers into battle.
meanings.sent2: The centurion was respected by all the soldiers under his command.
meanings.sent3: The centurion organized a surprise party for his troops.
meanings.sent4: She was a centurion of discipline, ensuring every soldier followed orders.
meanings.sent5: The centurion's armor gleamed in the sunlight as he stood at the front line.

meanings.definition: A leader or officer in charge of a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: The centurion of the club welcomed new members warmly.
meanings.sent2: As the centurion of the team, he made important decisions.
meanings.sent3: The centurion of the book club always picked the best novels.
meanings.sent4: She was the centurion of the office, ensuring tasks were completed on time.
meanings.sent5: The centurion of the choir conducted with passion and precision.
